intro: Schoberia cycloptera, commonly known as the spiral-leaved tansy, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed areas. Its aromatic leaves contain compounds that have been used in traditional medicine.
